reviewText: I'm not sure what is added to this movie from the original but a classic flick is still a classic.
Title: Night of the Living Dead VHS

reviewText: For the period, this movie was really done well until the ending.  We get these kinds of garbage endings from Hollywood today which is why we don't watch many new movies.  Maybe this was the one that started the trend?  If the ending had been better I would have given it 4 stars, but since I wasted time that I cannot get back it gets 1 star,
Title: Night of the Living Dead VHS

reviewText: What makes this movie work so well is that it relies on real scarry creatures, eerie direction and great use of black and white film while later versions relied on gory special effect body mutilations.The movie starts right out with a funeral in a grave yard.  A man and his sister are visiting their mother's grave and the woman is quite unnerved about being in the graveyard.  The man starts to play on her uneasiness saying things like "Barbara, they're coming to get you Barbara."  Suddenly up walks a kind of frightening man and her brother than says "here comes one of them now."  We the audience still think nothing of it and the brother is still laughing and taunting his sister, when the strange man gets real close and then just starts attacking the brother.  We experience real horror as we realize that it is not really a scarry looking man but a kind of zombie.  After quickly dispatching her brother, the zombie starts to chase the already shaken Barbara.What follows is a very tense, well directed chase.  Barbara somehow gets away from the man/zombie and makes it to a house.  In the house she meets a few people that have taken refuge from the apparent army of zombies that are now walking around the area trying to kill anyone they see.We then meet the real star of the movie, a black man who serves as the "sane" leader of the refugees giving them direction on how to fortify the house against the attacking zombies.What follows are many tense moments inside the house as the people argue about what they need to do to surivive.Don't watch this movie at home alone!
Title: Night of the Living Dead VHS

reviewText: though its in black and white and has some wooden actors and funky diolauge, this movie will leave you chilled to the bone with some hungry monsters. this one has a woman and her brother going to the cemetary, a zombie kills her brother, she runs her ass off to a abandoned house and then she meets a black man(Duane Jones), bare with me folks I do not know there names, I forget. Zombies enclose the house and the 2 border up the windows and doors. then other folks from the basement come up and they have a sick girl down below. 2 other women and men. a girlfriend and a boyfriend get blown up in a car and the zombies eat the burnt flesh. the other man is shot to death and the mother of the sick girl gets stabbed in the chest by the girl with a spade and that scene is terrifying if you think of it. the girl from the beginning gets eaten alive by her zombie brother and the black guy(Duane Jones) gets shot in the end because the cops think hes a zombie. this movie leaves you with a cold chill running all threw your body
Title: Night of the Living Dead VHS

reviewText: The original, and still the best.  Just a digital remake of it, nice and handy for us kindle owners to keep in the cloud.  It's a normal day and you're visiting your fathers grave when suddenly, people start behaving oddly.  Next thing you know, your brothers dead and you can't find the keys to your car.  After a narrow escape you find a house in the middle of no where, and the people inside are all dead, or trying to eat you.  Don't worry, I'm sure you'll make it out okay in the end.....This is the only scarey moive I still can't watch alone in the dark after 35 years.  It's subtle theme of constant, ever worsening, fear is less about zombies and more about the breakdown of civility in the face of doom.  There's a reason this gets remastered and redigitized over and over, it's the greatest horror film of all times!
Title: Night of the Living Dead VHS

reviewText: The Night of the Living Dead is one of my all time favorites. I was surprised on the clarity of this cut. It was good to see such a clear version. Way better clarity than my DVD copy.
Title: Night of the Living Dead VHS

reviewText: Great edition of the greatest zombie film of all time. Many zombie moves are made today using better equipment and budgets many times higher than this movie but none come close to Night Of The Living Dead.
summary: Night of the Living Dead 40th Anniversary Edition
